DOC.brief_summary: The investigator perform 1-year clinical trial measure objective compliance mandibular advancement device ( MAD ) treatment . The investigator enroll 50 patient receive treatment titratable , duobloc MAD ( RespiDent Butterfly® , RespiDent , Nijlen , Belgium ) participate original study `` Objective versus subjective compliance oral appliance therapy obstructive sleep apnea hypopnea syndrome '' , register Clinical Trials.gov ( NCT01284881 ) . Active microsensors ( TheraMon® , Handelsagentur Gschladt , Hargelsberg , Austria ) provide Handelsagentur Gschladt without cost . The sample interval record do rate 1 measurement per 15 minute ( every 900 second ) . Using sample interval , capacity active microsensor allow data acquisition 100 day period . A follow-up appointment schedule +/- 265 day start original study . A second follow-up visit schedule 1 year start original study . The objective measurement MAD wear time ( total hour wear time mean hour wear per night respective period ) base assumption MAD wear chip record temperature intraorally .
DOC.brief_title: The 1 Year Follow-up Objective Oral Appliance Compliance
DOC.detailed_description: This clinical trial extension trial 10/48/340 , register Clinical Trials.gov ( NCT01284881 ) .
DOC.criteria: clinical diagnosis sleepdisordered breathing start treatment titratable , duobloc mandibular advancement device participate original study 10/48/340 ( 3 month followup compliance treatment mandibular advancement device ) dental exclusion criterion mandibular advancement device medical contraindication mandibular advancement device
